name: Analysis for Decision-Making
description: The course develops understanding and practical skills of applying quantitative analysis for making better management decisions. Studies methodologies include linear and integer programming; multi-criteria optimization; waiting line models; decision analysis. Methodologies are practiced in a broad range of typical business problems drawn from different areas of management.
prerequisites: [MATA29H3 or MATA30H3 or MATA31H3 or MATA32H3] and [MATA33H3 or MATA35H3 or MATA36H3 or MATA37H3] and MGEB02H3/(ECMB02H3) and MGEB11H3/(ECMB11H3) and MGEB12H3/(ECMB12H3) and [MGTA36H3 or MGTA35H3]
